Trial_Design.evidence: Patients undergoing EVAR were randomized to doxycycline (100mg twice daily) or placebo for 6 months following the procedure.

Intervention.evidence: Patients undergoing EVAR were randomized to doxycycline (100mg twice daily) or placebo for 6 months following the procedure.

Objective.evidence: The goal of this study was to evaluate the effect of a MMP inhibitor, doxycycline, on EVAR.

Method_Outcome.evidence: Plasma MMP-9 decreased significantly below baseline in the doxycycline (N=20) treated patients at 6 months.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Plasma MMP-9 decreased significantly below baseline in the doxycycline (N=20) treated patients at 6 months while there was a non-significant increase in the placebo (N=24) group.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Forty-four subjects were analyzed based on intention-to-treat.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Plasma MMP-9 decreased significantly below baseline in the doxycycline (N=20) treated patients at 6 months (−16.4±20.7%, P<0.05) while there was a non-significant increase in the placebo (N=24) group (128.1±73.5%).
